edu.rit.util

Class BigInt

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.BigInt

  • public class BigInt
extends java.lang.Object
    Class BigInt provides an arbitrary-size unsigned integer. Internally, a bigint is represented as an array of 32-bit words containing the bigint's value in little-endian order.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] value
      Array of 32-bit words containing this bigint's value in little-endian order.

    • Constructor Summary

      Construct a new bigint that is a copy of the given bigint.
      BigInt(int bitSize)
      Construct a new bigint with the value 0.

      • value

        public final int[] value
        Array of 32-bit words containing this bigint's value in little-endian order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigInt

        public BigInt(int bitSize)
        Construct a new bigint with the value 0.
        Parameters:
        bitSize - Bit size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if bitSize < 0.

    • Method Detail

      • wordSize

        public int wordSize()
        Returns this bigint's word size. This is the number of 32-bit words required to hold this bigint's value.
        Returns:
        Word size.

      • bitSize

        public int bitSize()
        Returns this bigint's bit size. This is the word size times 32.
        Returns:
        Bit size.

      • randomize

        public BigInt randomize(Random prng)
        Set this bigint to a randomly chosen value. The value is chosen uniformly at random in the range 0 to 2B−1, where B is this bigint's bit size.
        Parameters:
        prng - Pseudorandom number generator.
        Returns:
        This bigint.

      • randomize

        public BigInt randomize(Random prng,
               int B)
        Set this bigint to a randomly chosen value in the given range. The value is chosen uniformly at random in the range 0 to 2B−1, where B is the smaller of the argument B and this bigint's bit size.
        Parameters:
        prng - Pseudorandom number generator.
        B - Number of bits to choose at random.
        Returns:
        This bigint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if B < 0.

      • fromString

        public BigInt fromString(java.lang.String s)
        Set this bigint's value from the given string.
        Parameters:
        s - Hexadecimal value. The hexadecimal bytes of this string are in big-endian order.
        Returns:
        This bigint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if s is null.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if s is not a hexadecimal value.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert this bigint's value to a string. The hexadecimal bytes of this bigint are displayed in big-endian order.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String value.

      • assign

        public BigInt assign(int v)
        Set this bigint's value to the given unsigned integer.
        Parameters:
        v - Unsigned integer value.
        Returns:
        This bigint, with its value set to v.

      • assign

        public BigInt assign(BigInt bigint)
        Set this bigint's value to that of the given bigint.
        Parameters:
        bigint - Bigint.
        Returns:
        This bigint, with its value set to that of bigint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if bigint's bit size is not the same as this bigint's bit size.

      • increment

        public BigInt increment()
        Increment this bigint.
        Returns:
        This bigint, with its value increased by 1.

        bigint - Bigint.

      • complement

        Complement this bigint.
        Returns:

      • getBit

        public int getBit(int i)
        Get the bit at the given position in this bigint.
        Parameters:
        i - Bit position.
        Returns:
        Bit at position i (0 or 1).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if i is out of bounds.

      • putBit

        public BigInt putBit(int i,
            int v)
        Put the given value into the bit at the given position in this bigint.
        Parameters:
        i - Bit position.
        v - Bit value (0 or 1).
        Returns:
        This bigint, with bit position i set to v.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if i is out of bounds.

      • flipBit

        public BigInt flipBit(int i)
        Flip the bit at the given position in this bigint.
        Parameters:
        i - Bit position.
        Returns:
        This bigint, with bit position i flipped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if i is out of bounds.

      • scatterBits

        public BigInt scatterBits(int[] pos,
                 long val)
        Scatter bits of the given long integer into the given positions in this bigint. Bit position 0 of val goes into bit position pos[0] of this bigint, bit position 1 of val goes into bit position pos[1] of this bigint, and so on.
        Parameters:
        pos - Array of bit positions in this bigint.
        val - Long integer to scatter.
        Returns:
        This bigint, as modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any bit position in pos is out of bounds.

      • scatterBits

        public BigInt scatterBits(int[] pos,
                 BigInt val)
        Scatter bits of the given bigint into the given positions in this bigint. Bit position 0 of val goes into bit position pos[0] of this bigint, bit position 1 of val goes into bit position pos[1] of this bigint, and so on.
        Parameters:
        pos - Array of bit positions in this bigint.
        val - Bigint to scatter.
        Returns:
        This bigint, as modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any bit position in pos is out of bounds.

      • leftShift

        public BigInt leftShift(int shift)
        Left-shift this bigint.
        Parameters:
        shift - Number of bit positions to shift.
        Returns:
        This bigint, left-shifted by shift bits.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if shift < 0.

      • rightShift

        public BigInt rightShift(int shift)
        Right-shift this bigint.
        Parameters:
        shift - Number of bit positions to shift.
        Returns:
        This bigint, right-shifted by shift bits.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if shift < 0.

      • pack

        public void pack(int[] array)
        Pack the given integer array into this bigint in little-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L > array.length.

      • pack

        public void pack(int[] array,
        int off)
        Pack a portion of the given integer array into this bigint in little-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes off through off+L−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to pack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L > array.length.

      • unpack

        public void unpack(int[] array)
        Unpack this bigint into the given integer array in little-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into elements of the array at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L > array.length.

      • unpack

        public void unpack(int[] array,
          int off)
        Unpack this bigint into a portion of the given integer array in little-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into elements of the array at indexes off through off+L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to unpack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L > array.length.

      • packBigEndian

        public void packBigEndian(int[] array)
        Pack the given integer array into this bigint in big-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L > array.length.

      • packBigEndian

        public void packBigEndian(int[] array,
                 int off)
        Pack a portion of the given integer array into this bigint in big-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes off through off+L−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to pack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L > array.length.

      • unpackBigEndian

        public void unpackBigEndian(int[] array)
        Unpack this bigint into the given integer array in big-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0 are copied into elements of the array at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L > array.length.

      • unpackBigEndian

        public void unpackBigEndian(int[] array,
                   int off)
        Unpack this bigint into a portion of the given integer array in big-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0 are copied into elements of the array at indexes off through off+L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to unpack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L > array.length.

      • pack

        public void pack(long[] array)
        Pack the given long integer array into this bigint in little-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes 0 through L/2−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L/2 > array.length.

      • pack

        public void pack(long[] array,
        int off)
        Pack a portion of the given long integer array into this bigint in little-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes off through off+L/2−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to pack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L/2 > array.length.

      • unpack

        public void unpack(long[] array)
        Unpack this bigint into the given long integer array in little-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into elements of the array at indexes 0 through L/2−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L/2 > array.length.

      • unpack

        public void unpack(long[] array,
          int off)
        Unpack this bigint into a portion of the given long integer array in little-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes 0 through L−1 are copied into elements of the array at indexes off through off+L/2−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        off - First array index to unpack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L/2 > array.length.

        public void packBigEndian(long[] array)
        Pack the given long integer array into this bigint in big-endian order. Elements of the array at indexes 0 through L/2−1 are copied into words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L/2 > array.length.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L/2 > array.length.

      • unpackBigEndian

        public void unpackBigEndian(long[] array)
        Unpack this bigint into the given long integer array in big-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0 are copied into elements of the array at indexes 0 through L/2−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:
        array - Integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L/2 > array.length.

      • unpackBigEndian

        public void unpackBigEndian(long[] array,
                   int off)
        Unpack this bigint into a portion of the given long integer array in big-endian order. Words of this bigint at indexes L−1 through 0 are copied into elements of the array at indexes off through off+L/2−1, where L is this bigint's word size.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if L is not a multiple of 2.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0 or off+L/2 > array.length.

      • eq

        public boolean eq(BigInt bigint)
        Determine if this bigint's value equals the given bigint's value.
        Parameters:
        bigint - Bigint.
        Returns:
        True if values are equal, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if bigint's bit size is not the same as this bigint's bit size.
